zPgHo9yT4ubc3lnyEsQc-Q.text: Quick (even though very popular so has a massive queue!), friendly and helpful, though bland pad thai.

auhhV-TnFLOUpVx-GFps5g.text: I really like the big bowel noodles here.The shop was well maintained and the service was fast.It was really nice to have some nice food when you were tired after shopping for hours.The soup with the noodle was very nice and you would feel much better after the light lunch.High recommended in the westfield shopping center for food.

l7JxWDLwJHoZS_9gFYysiw.text: Jesus, Mary and Joseph....you mean I have to travel all the way to London and spend those daggone GBPs only to have the worst bowl of pho I have ever, ever had?  Jeez!  Don't they know that things are far more expensive there than here?  Especially for a bowl of pho?!?  We all know the soup is where its at, and Pho's soup is so tasteless and bland that they need to change their name to "Noodle Bowl".  I added hoisin sauce.  I added cock sauce (tribute to Jade, of course).  I added soy sauce, salt, anything and everything to bring a little life to the soup.  Fail.On the flip side, their iced coffee was pretty tasty.Never again.  I'd rather eat balut!Wait, that was drastic.  I'd rather starve, how's that.

Od4MB9EUoJ5jWADFhQeg0g.text: I didn't mind the Pho at the Shepherds Bush Westfield mall. I mean it is mall food so I didn't go expecting the best Pho of my life. The portions were huge, and the flavors were almost there. I just wished the noodles had a bit more punch. They were a bit bland despite the pretty tasty beef broth (which I added soy, cilantro, lime, hoisin, and more chilies too.)  Buttt still I'm not sure it was completely worth the money. Obviously I'm a bit on the fence but I would probably go back.

hja1XVrFc6yHmk99so3VDw.text: More good street food from Westfield, this time Vietnamese. As other reviewers have said, you have to wait for the meal (today there was a long queue as well) but it's certainly worth the wait. Extremely fresh tasting food which is made to order, with side dishes of sauce at various levels of spicyness. The summer rolls really tasted like summer, which was quite an achievement for a winter's day in Westfield shopping centre. I wasn't feeling adventurous enough for the weasel coffee a rare coffee regurgitated by wild Vietnamese weasels. I came over a bit Catherine Tate when I saw that. Coffee, regurgitated by weasels, and this was Shepherd's Bush. Dirty B'stards ;-) But instead had a freshly made carrot, apple and ginger juice which balanced the spicy meal really well.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho - London, United Kingdom. Goi Cuon Tom
Photo of Pho - London, United Kingdom. Bun Cha
Photo of Pho - London, United Kingdom. Weasel Coffee on the menu at Pho

vhj41b4nLXUvW8O7oi-7Dw.text: Yeah... this is not anything near the quality of pho in California.... minimal amount of veggies (not fresh either). Pretty expensive relatively. Broth was pretty nice though.

8qsmYLq50FrvChuNrJbLEw.text: What a disastrous meal! My Bun (noodle salad) was HOT.  Wait, let's start with a prelude, before I got my food.I know this isn't about pho per say, but I was well pissed at the people working at Westfield food court because they were doing sweet F.A while watching me struggle to lug a baby chair to a table.  I know you work at a food court, I know it's sunday, I know it's a shit job.  You are paid to help.  SO HELP. Customer service- Nil point.In my frazzled and pissed mood, I asked my sister to order me a prawn bun- she swore she ordered me prawn, but I got a pork meatball one instead.  HOT, with soggy noodles and enough bean sprouts to feed a family of 4.  Roughly 4 pieces of ice berg and 8 thumb size "meat balls" which tasted so floury and weird that i thought I bit into raw meat.  The bun itself came swimming in soy sauce and therefore the entire meal tasted like an extremely badly made, semi raw stir fried noodle rather than a refreshing salad. I can still taste the disgustingness after 2 scoops of gelato mio and an amazing home made prime rib.  The horridness sort of go away when I ate the delicious food, but then it came back.  Never again.

kehWNJM4UZxl8-prBt6LVA.text: The pho was amazingwill definitely visit you guys again

qlcLvMm13THKZsfiyUHxwQ.text: Arriving at Westfields for a bit of retail therapy, our grumbling tummies led us towards the busy food haul on the first floor.The range of restaurants can be a bit overwhelming, but on a recommendation, I headed to Pho. Fans of Wagamama will appreciate the selection of noodle based dishes and soups. I chose the king prawn based noodles, complete with side salad and crumbled peanuts. The food was fast, tasty, budget friendly (change from a tenner was gratefully received) For tasty fast food, Pho is a must-visit

eIWoJhBPtyiIKyGsQguGog.text: I'll eat here sometimes because there's really no other good Vietnamese in the mall or its environs. Can be quite bland at times and wanting in nuance in the broth's taste.

S0O0RpaAEH4yZKCtdvPvFA.text: I really enjoy the noodle soup.

bKqvmfC5jyNX9BBmLC3RaQ.text: Awesome noodle soup in the surprisingly pleasant Westfield shopping centre. Discovered this place when we were travelling up the escalators to the Pizza Express to use some voucher or other. The smell drifting from the bowls below was too good to avoid though. They serve good summer rolls, vietnamese coffee and a selection of south east asian beers as well - not least Beer Lao which is great

ts5iX6_UdM1t8G5t5I9Y9g.text: While it has a fantastic selection, I've been here 3 times or so, and everything tastes the same. Save yourself some cash, hit Chop Chop noodle bar around the corner on Shepherd's Bush green.

U42PuYOmmAWwQMUltGHtaw.text: Very reasonable indeed  who knew you could dine out for two on under £15!! Especially in Westfields. Pho is by far one of the better restaurants on the balcony and would definitely return if I was ever in the area!

JHQrLxXqmC-CahEYlASc-A.text: A giant big bowl of fresh, tasty and very satisfying Bun noodles was exactly what I needed after a hard day's shopping. They have a great selection of rice-noodle soups, stir fry noodles and interesting-looking salads - all freshly made to order, which does mean a bit of a wait at peak times (20 minutes on Sat eve) but well worth it! Their freshly pressed juices (e.g. apple, mint and lime) are excellent and if you're feeling adventurous, try the weasel coffee. (apparently, it's correctly pronounced like the fu in fun)

Cl673zuvpwlXrVd3larxhA.text: I love pho! and I have the hardest time finding Pho in England so I am beyond delighted when I do find it... Pho puts me in a happy mood for the rest of the day... during lunch hours I think this place has the longest line out of any others in the food court which is soo annoying. but it was worth it! im so happy to know they have a pho place at the westfield mall i will be coming back just for a pho fix :) I was also happy to see Lao beer since I went to Laos I have never seen any other place in america or England with Lao beer... it brought back sweet memories... the only thing is it is £4 and in Laos it is like 20 Pence for a beer...crazy English prices... anyways I will be coming back to this place for sure. The one thing that I like too is that they have all the spicy sauces I like to put in my soup too :) YUM

Y1ze1nvCKI5TfXOh07jVgA.text: We could smell the Star Anise in the mall and just knew we had to try the Pho.  We had only been in England for 3 days, but the Pho withdrawal was hitting hard and this Pho restaurant appeared like a mirage in the desert.Oh my, how much did I dislike? Let me count the ways...Broth - very bland flavours except Beef, it tastes like it was made from a stock cube.Veggies (Them) - small amount of beansprouts, some lime, sliced Thai chillies and few brown mint leaves ( no basil, no seesaw:( )Meat - let's just say they were 'sparing' with the meatHoi-Sin - nopeSriracha Sauce - nope, never heard of it :(Our spoons were mini ladles, crap to eat from but look really cool.  They are trying to make Pho a fine dining experience, good luck to them, but if you like da Pho, stay the hell away!

xBqHTnw660OsOSt2001oJg.text: This place is horrible.  Smells like pho, kind of looks like pho, tastes like dirty dish water.  I have had some bad pho before but this takes the cake.  It was just all wrong.  wrong. wrong.   The search for pho in London goes on.

rMdmHz05s7KYT3j9i4cnQw.text: I always restrict my fast food consumption to McDonald's, and leave Asian/Oriental food to the experts (just like I won't go to Wagamama for Japanese food). As a fast food chain I do doubt Pho's authenticity, but the food is reasonably good, especially when it is served up in under five minutes. The spring rolls are divine, but the soup noodles could do with a bit more noodles.

hXB2TrGTcxu1xcf5Qhx4sg.text: This is what fast food should be about, and what makes it so great is that it's so fresh and clean and you don't feel like your arteries are getting furry.

U62kQrUlpHSl49tRFrEY1A.text: The soup here is always fresh, light and filling - though the beef pho was much tastier than the chicken - and the spring rolls are crispy and yum. The fresh fruit juice is lovely and it amounts to a really good lunch when you are hungry from all that shopping. Only downsides are that sometimes the line is long and the staff can be a bit rude, and also it is a bit pricey and nothing like as rich as more authentic food. worth a try though

3uxL9T36Yzw4q86OS6JzGA.text: The food is nice, albeit slightly corporate and not as Vietnamese-y as you'd like. the environment is nice, and the presentation is acceptable. However, at the end of the day, you're still eating inside a shopping centre!

N_d7wSSjZguPF2kkrhmpkw.text: As a Vietnamese, I was initially very intrigued to try the Pho franchise and after returning about 4 different times, I am still on the fence about it.This Pho is inside Westfield and it can get a little chaotic. I prefer eating at a full restaurant location rather than in a food court at the mall. The biggest downside is ordering your food and having it ready before you find yourself a table to sit! It's quite embarrassing carrying a tray of Pho around the block of tables 5 times...They have all the basic Vietnamese street food, like Pho (Vietnamese Noodle Soup) and Com Tam (Broken Rice). Sometimes the broth for Pho can be bland. At some locations, it taste like my mum's cooking. Other times, they miss the mark. The chicken for Bun Ga was horrible in general. It was more like salad with roasted chicken. I drowned that dish with fish sauce and it still didn't taste any better. Food is mostly decent, but it is NOT authentic Vietnamese food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho - London, United Kingdom. Bun Ga va Cha Gio (Dried noodles with chicken and egg rolls)

aazdcKIu7jeB0xaB5SuZZQ.text: How can this establishment claim their soup as Pho when the broth doesn't even come close to tasting like Pho? The broth tasted like that beef cube that you drop in hot water then the noodles were thick! The fried egg rolls were raw inside, and it's made out of pork. Couldn't eat it! Pretty bad. Not even close to Vietnamese food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho - London, United Kingdom. Pork egg rolls... it looked ok.... but inside was undercooked.... nasty
Photo of Pho - London, United Kingdom. Thick noodles... broth is not a Pho broth, a shredded cooked beef! Terrible
Photo of Pho - London, United Kingdom

8DzumuoIca8cw85i2aIJ4g.text: Its in the mall, and when we are exhausted after a day of shopping & just want a simple soup without noodles, this is not a bad option. Its not the best pho in the world, but it isn't bad either.A quick light & healthy pick me up, they do takeaway too, so we sometimes pick up a couple of pho to consume at home in comfort.

PXqBu_VUxmzcjOyqwm3fbg.text: Fast, reasonably priced and tastes Ok. If you've had good pho,, you are likely to be underwhelmed but this is in a food court in a shopping mall, so set your expectations accordingly.

OjtGCMShdAfJ0KT26CISWw.text: Came here about three times since I love Vietnamese pho. And all three times have been below average. I tried so hard to like this place and have it fill the Vietnamese food void in  my stomach. Unfortunately, the broth is just not tasty or hearty enough. The meat and meatballs are just barely ok. I dunno, perhaps I have been too spoilt by the Vietnamese food in Los Angeles. The search continues for a place that serves quality pho.

emS6L39tqXHwPIu63Wkhbg.text: Really enjoyed it for what it's worth. I've had better vietnamese food though.I'd recommend the pho (see picture) as it's a staple for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho - London, United Kingdom

hJzoPlo4LB81WztEYyozgg.text: Well given the mixed reviews, I am going to go against the grain and say I loved it!! The food was tasty and fresh. Good menu with a great choice of dishes. I was really impressed with the salad, the beef was great. We also had spring and summer rolls. The shrimp summer rolls were lacking in shrimp. I enjoyed the pork spring rolls more - great flavour!

McqNLzwxwMPSI5FQaN2sGA.text: I got a "Pho Xao Thit Ga" (£7.75) which are flat wok-fried noodles with peanuts, bean sprouts and greens, and pretty fierce chilli for England's standards. My noodles were meant to contain chicken and shrimp, but somehow they got lots of chicken into my noodles and no shrimp at all. Heck, I was hungry and didn't bother to request a change. (edit: There's an extra "Tom" suffix after the name of the dish if I wanted mine with prawns, which my sister probably missed out when ordering. Okay.)The noodles were very tasty, and the ingredients were generous. The spiciness level was definitely above that of the average apprehensive-when-it-comes-to-spicy-Asian-food English person, but it was manageable for myself - my spiciness-tolerance-level isn't that high either.My sister got the famed beef noodles. (edit: there are about 8 types of beef noodles on the menu and I don't know which one she got) I have no idea why the dish is the star of the menu, it really was nothing much. The beef balls were pretty good, but the soup was average. Maybe it's because I've had better ones from Southeast Asia itself, and that the dish is a rare treat in this part of the world?The food court is a lovely place to sit in, and there's free wi-fi too.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho - London, United Kingdom. "Pho Xao Thit Ga" (7.75) from Pho @ Westfields Shepherd's Bush

CT4A6PNFUAh8wVHsWv0bXw.text: Picked up some noodles cause we always walk by and they always look delicious. We got the spicy chicken noodles and the steak and garlic noodles.Both had lots of meat and noodles in them, however we did have to add a lot of spices and sauces to the broth to give it more flavour. I was absolutely stuffed afterwards!We also got the veggie summer roll which was really nice an refreshing. I liked the mint in it.

BDIt2XVQy7pfn-ZC-BWMXQ.text: This is the second time I have been here in the last 6 months. Do not go here if you want good Vietnamese  Pho.  Go to kingsland Road. Had the beef noodles, should have returned it, bone dry beef and flavourless sauce. Will not return . I thought the last visit was a one off, clearly nobody here cares about serving decent noodles and Pho.

IjWOyNUAdrBOiW6ZcjhZXA.text: So let me qualify this by saying I am not a conossier of vietnamese food. Located in the food court of Westfield this is a relatively stapple / decent place to grab a quick bite.I have eaten here on two occassions but to be honest the food court at Westfield - as well as the restaurants offers so much variety I don't think this is a particular enditment.Avoid turning up too late during lunch as there tend to be queues - I guess that means that people do love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho - London, United Kingdom

h7dJ72kPSR9d5sSV-hrg1A.text: I ordered the spicy beef soup with one of the Vietnamese beers which Pho offers. The beer did a perfect job of neutralizing all of the peppers and spices that were used in the dish. I was delighted with all of the herbs and spices used in the soup to create a more complex dish; however, I was a tad bit disappointed with the beef. It was neither a chunk or a thin slice, so the beef did not absorb the flavors of the soup as effectively as another cut would have.

nG-0RqkEpHCFYi3X8ieI5A.text: This is now the FOURTH Pho location we've been to in the UK!  I think I should get a free one, or something.  This one is on the upper floor of the Westfield shopping center, in a little food court area.  They have a slightly smaller menu compared to the proper restaurant locations, but the prices are the same.  I ordered the chicken pho again, and the green beans/sugar snaps in peanut sauce as a side.  They gave us an electric buzzer while we took a seat (seating area in this part of Westfields is indoor, but great for people watching and has chargers for your phone!) and the food was ready in about 5 minutes.The pho comes in a wide bowl, not disposable even though it's a food court.  Nice as it feels more like a proper restaurant.  They have hot sauces at the counter that you can use to spice up your meal, and they give you a little bowl of herbs/chillis/bean sprouts as always.  After doctoring our soups to the proper temperature, we dug in - and they were lovely.  Just as they always are at a Pho restaurant, the broth was lovely.  I know it's not the classic pho, but I think the chicken broth is almost better than the beef!  It's more soothing in a way, like Asian chicken noodle soup.  It was hot (temperature-wise, also spicy after I dumped in some hot sauce), and truly hit the spot on a day when it was pouring rain.  The chicken was juicy and the noodles were abundant.   I love the crisp veggies in the sweet and yummy peanut sauce as well, if you want a veg they are probably your best option.Very affordable, and a deliciously filling meal as always.  We're addicted, if you can't tell!

fiwD7hpIewbpjiEOpyoPoA.text: I hate giving a one star! I believe it reflects on me - on my poor choice. I don't like making poor choices. Unfortunately, you have to in order to learn. Let me start by saying that I am Asian, my bff is Vietnamese, I had a Viet ex-bf, and I've been to Hanoi, Vietnam. This will be a harsh judgment. It was my last day (maybe last two) in London with no wifi to steal so I can go on yelp, while I was in Shepherd's Bush. Yes, I was shopping if you had to ask, now whatever you think of me due to the places I visited, please put aside. I originally came from Oxford Circus and stopped here then I got hungry. My first intuition was to get out of the mall and eat somewhere else, even at Sam's Chicken, anywhere besides the food court inside the mall. Yet, I ignored them and ordered pho and egg rolls. They were the right size, mind you. They weren't American size, they were the perfect size! How dare you feed me this shit! Pho rice noodles shouldn't be this fat and soggy! The meat weren't supposed to be this cooked! My broth wasn't supposed to taste artificial! You were supposed to give me a bowl of rice noodles (cooked for 2 minutes, washed in cold water), a broth from a cow's hip bone (or some area) simmered for 24 hours (to get the bone fat in the broth), topped with onions, basil, mint, and coriander, with thin-sliced rare steak that will cook in me broth! Ask me what else could go wrong? My egg rolls weren't crunchy, no noodles inside, no meat, just nasty soil-tasting bean sprouts and carrots. No lettuce to wrap it in. It was the first time I didn't finish a bowl of pho and I was starving. I hate you! You even charged me £12! Not even worth a fiver for both! I had to nurse my tummy with yummy old Jamaican ginger beer and a bag of Maltesers from Tesco. So bad, but ohhh so good!

-ID2--bsmPiUys_H7zx8TQ.text: We came here to grab a quick bite before the mall closed after a long day of shopping. We weren't too hungry so just needed something light. We decided on pho ga (chicken soup with rice noodles) and the imperial rolls. The imperial rolls were pretty good, nice and crispy. The noodles though.. for real... I've had sooo much better. The soup was ok but the noodles weren't chewy or fresh like pho noodles should be. They actually gave some decent amount of chicken though. The side mint was a nice touch.... but no lime!? The red jalapeño on the side was nice and spicy too but not the traditional green jalapeños. It was also sad that there was NO sriracha sauce... AHHHH!!Anyway, it wasn't all bad but definitely forgettable. A big fat minus is that its in an area by the ice skating rink. There was a super loud emcee yelling at the top of his lungs and it made the worst dining experience

v8CaEDrYO9h5MOmlvdKyjg.text: I come from Southern California where Pho is pretty much a staple in my area. Was looking everywhere in London for a good bowl of Pho. This place does it pretty well.

TRlsdejmAT1jnCwmCji-rg.text: I have only had the spring rolls here, which were actually decent.... but if you're looking for authentic Vietnamese food, this is not the place to go!

GSK8GnOm4YuoHvOYcHZSHQ.text: Arrived at 8pm, long queue. Service is fast enough and you will find place to sit.Ordered a bun cha gio Bo xao sa: in other words vermicelli rice with beef and vegetable.Not the best, I ever eat. Nems were to dry and not enough beef.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho - London, United Kingdom. Beer, beeper & receipt
Photo of Pho - London, United Kingdom. Incredients for bun

0dB1GjxJE5LzsIFAmMBuJw.text: Very expensive cheap food - blander then you could imagine possible given the alleged ingredients used, poorly cooked/reheated and lacking any nutritional value detectable. I've been four times now and tried four meals, including sides, and been thoroughly disappointed each time. Given the extortionate prices asked for what is essentially fast food, Pho Westfield should be ashamed of itself. The reviews on here are negative for a reason and I won't be back unless there's a visible change in quality. If you find yourself hankering for something to eat in the food-court that's fast, Chip & Fish, Yo! Sushi & that risotto place I can never remember the name of are all better alternatives.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho - London, United Kingdom

C7CiiMduILzA0EHrmj1bbg.text: Fast, quick food that, in my opinion, is the pick of all the outlets in the food court at Westfield. There is always a long queue during the weekends and lunchtimes, so best to try during an offpeak hour! The noodle soups were quite good, although not as good as the authentic stuff in the Vietnamese restaurants near Old Street. The spring rolls were very filling, but it lacked any taste or spice, but was full of veggies so definitely a healthy option.
